result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonta D Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devonta D Jones in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Devonta D Jones.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctor's report.  Parties do not contest the report.  Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Court set plea/sentencing date upon request from the defense. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-26-2022
Received and Filed:  Doctor's report dated 10-13-2022.

Defendant Devonta D Jones in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Devonta D Jones.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Pankiewicz on 10-12-2022 at 12:00 pm.  Court ordered case is adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 40.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and Filed:  Order for Competency Exam
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-28-2022

Defendant Devonta D Jones in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appeared by video for Devonta D Jones.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-30-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 08-23-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 08-09-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 06-23-2022

Defendant Devonta D Jones in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective D. Bettin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and granted in part. Count 1 is dismissed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-15-2022
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION) Report, filed.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Per a call from District 3 police department the defendant is there in person. He's unable to zoom for Court. He doesn't have a telephone and is unable to get to the Court to appear in person. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defendant is to appear in person on the next date. Defense is also advised that the defendant needs to establish contact with Justice Point.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-03-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 04-28-2022

Defendant Devonta D Jones in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEARED BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears by phone. Defense requests an adjournment to allow client to appear in person. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04-07-2022
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 03-24-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
May be removed from supervision and placed in court reminders if compliant for 120 days.

Defendant Devonta D Jones in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Devonta D Jones in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonta D Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
